Tools

Class Cords

  • java.lang.Object
    • Tools.Cords

  • public class Cords
extends java.lang.Object
    this class represents a simple coordinate conversion between lat/lon (sphere) to Cartesian, allowing to convert lat/lon coordinations to x,y (pixels / meters). Moreover it allows performing computations in lat / lon in terms of direction (angle), distance (meter). Note: this code was written for IoT devices - it is in C-like java style. Tests are based on the following cordinates: p1 p2 p3 x 35.209687 35.20954 35.210063 lon y 32.10283 32.10368 32.104084 lat z 680 685 691 p1-->p2 p1-->p3 p2-->p3 96.5 147 69 65 351.5 14.1 47

      static double angXY(double dx, double dy)
      this static function compute the angle from 0,0 to x,y assuming north is 0, east is 90, south =180, west = 270
      static double[] azmDist(double[] ll1, double[] ll2)
      this function computes the azimuth and distance (and dz) in degrees and meters between two lat/lon points.

      static double deg2Rad(double deg) 
      static double dist2D_Lat_Lon(Point3D a, Point3D b) 
      static double[] flatWorldDist(double[] ll1, double[] ll2)
      this method computes the flat world distance vector between two global points (lat-north, lon-east, alt-above-sea) assuming the two points are relatively close .
      static Point3D flatWorldDist(Point3D a, Point3D b)
      a Simple distance in meter between to lat/lon/alt locations.
      static double[] offsetLatLonAlt(double[] ll1, double[] vec)
      This method gets a Lat-Lon-Alt global coordination and a vector (in meters) (east, north, up) it returns a new Lat-Lon-Alt global coordination which is the offset of the inpot point with the vector.

      • azmDist

        public static double[] azmDist(double[] ll1,
                               double[] ll2)
        this function computes the azimuth and distance (and dz) in degrees and meters between two lat/lon points. NOTE: this function is used by many navigation higher level function do NOT change it unless you fully understand - use all Junits - to make sure the change is not adding bugs.
        Parameters:
        ll1 - first GPS cords
        ll2 - second GPS cords
        Returns:
        [azm,dist,dz];

      • offsetLatLonAlt

        public static double[] offsetLatLonAlt(double[] ll1,
                                       double[] vec)
        This method gets a Lat-Lon-Alt global coordination and a vector (in meters) (east, north, up) it returns a new Lat-Lon-Alt global coordination which is the offset of the inpot point with the vector. Assumes the vector is smaller than 100km).
        Parameters:
        ll1 -
        vec -
        Returns:
